Amiodarone is the most effective antiarrhythmic drug for the prevention of atrial fibrillation (AF) 1, 2, 3, and it is recommended for patients with frequent, symptomatic AF recurrences, especially in the presence of structural heart disease(4). However, several potential drawbacks may limit the use of amiodarone in patients with AF.
